wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Falconer (1738–1792) was an English classical scholar.

response: Hodson edited Thomas Falconer's Chronological Tables, 1796. His probationary exercise as a fellow of Brasenose was published in the same year, entitled The Eternal Filiation of the Son of God asserted on the Evidence of the Sacred Scriptures, pp. 81. His only other works were three sermons published at Liverpool, and printed in 1797, 1799, and 1804.
Thomas Falconer (1805–1882) was an English jurist and explorer.
Thomas Falconer may also refer to:

Gower made collections for a history of Cheshire, and in 1771 printed an anonymous Sketch of the Materials for a new History of Cheshire, taking the form of a letter to Thomas Falconer. It was signed "a Fellow of the Antiquary Society", and reissued in 1772. He made collections also for a history of Essex, and a new edition of John Horsley's Britannia Romana.
*"Ode to Sleep", by Thomas Falconer (classical scholar)
